citation.article-title: Anoxybacillus gonensis sp. nov., a moderately thermophilic, xylose-utilizing, endospore-forming bacterium.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Anoxybacillus gonensis sp. nov.
Anoxybacillus gonensis (gon.en′sis. N.L. masc. adj. gonensis pertaining to Gonen, a hot spring in the province of Balikesir, Turkey, where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are rod-shaped, Gram-positive, motile and spore-forming, 0·75×5·0 μm.
Colonies are rough and cream in colour.
Glucose, glycogen, raffinose, sucrose, xylose, fructose and mannitol are utilized.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.
Urease, indole and H2S are not produced.
The pH range for growth is 6·0–10·0 (optimum pH 7·5–8·0).
The temperature range for growth is 40–70 °C (optimum 55–60 °C).
The G+C content of the DNA is 57 mol% (by melting temperature).
The type strain, G2T (=NCIMB 13933T=NCCB 100040T), was isolated from Gonen hot spring, Turkey.
